about.title: Designing, Coding and Making it Real
about.name: Yunus Emre Arslan
about.desc:
My interest in design, which started in childhood, continued with me until university. During my university years, interface design and user experience became topics I cared deeply about. Then, a question struck my mind: Why am I not coding the interfaces I design? This question led me to seriously research the Front-end field and start coding the interfaces I designed. This process gave me the ability to build a bridge between software and design.

‘Can I convey it in a simpler way?’ is a question I always ask myself in my work. If I have an answer to this question, I don't hesitate to scrap my work and start over.

I continue to research current design trends and front-end technologies and improve myself. In my free time, I enjoy learning about topics related to my field but from different areas because to be successful in your field, it is not enough to focus on just one area; it is important to be a multidisciplinary person to gain different perspectives.
